Interface CGInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ConstSymbol, FunctionSymbol, LabelSymbol, Operand3a, VarSymbol

    public interface CGInterface
    This interface must be implemented for assembly code generation. It defines a contract between TAC and code generator. In order for the code generator to work, a TAC operand must be an Operand3a object and it must answer all the requests defined in this interface. Some of these requests could be useful in the front-end of the compiler. It's your choice.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getName3a()
      This method must return a printable view of a TAC operand.
      int getScope()
      Returns the scope of a TAC operand if not meaningless.
      int getSize()
      Returns the size (in bytes) of a TAC operand unless meaningless.
      boolean isArray()
      Test if a TAC operand is an array
      boolean isConstInteger()
      Test if a TAC operand is an integer literal
      boolean isLabel()
      Test if a TAC operand is a label
      boolean isParam()
      Test if a TAC_VAR is a parameter of a function
      boolean isPointer()
      Test if a TAC operand is a pointer.
      boolean isVarInteger()
      Test if a TAC operand is an integer variable

      • isPointer

        boolean isPointer()
        Test if a TAC operand is a pointer. When an array is passed as a parameter, the value of the the address is passed to the subroutine. So it is a pointer.
        Returns:
        a boolean

      • isLabel

        boolean isLabel()
        Test if a TAC operand is a label
        Returns:
        a boolean

      • getName3a

        java.lang.String getName3a()
        This method must return a printable view of a TAC operand. Variable name for a variable, integer string for an integer. Recall that the TAC name of a function is the associated label!!
        Returns:
        String

      • getScope

        int getScope()
        Returns the scope of a TAC operand if not meaningless. Othewise, should return -1.
        Returns:
        integer

      • getSize

        int getSize()
        Returns the size (in bytes) of a TAC operand unless meaningless. -1 if not appropriate.
        Returns:
        the size
